questions.question: What is SOLAV Journal?
questions.answer: SOLAV Journal is a peer-reviewed, open-access academic journal that publishes interdisciplinary applied research and visioneering studies that bridge theory and practice.

questions.question: Is SOLAV an open-access journal?
questions.answer: Yes. All articles published in SOLAV are freely available online without subscription or paywall restrictions.

questions.question: Who publishes SOLAV Journal?
questions.answer: SOLAV Journal is published and managed by its editorial board and administrative team as described on the About page.

questions.question: Where can I find published volumes and issues?
questions.answer: All published articles and volumes are available in the journal archive.

questions.question: Does SOLAV accept international submissions?
questions.answer: Yes. SOLAV welcomes submissions from researchers worldwide without geographic restriction.

questions.question: What is the academic focus of SOLAV?
questions.answer: SOLAV focuses on interdisciplinary applied research, practical innovation, and future-oriented studies that connect theory with real-world impact.

questions.question: Which disciplines are accepted?
questions.answer: SOLAV accepts research from multiple disciplines provided it demonstrates applied relevance and interdisciplinary engagement.

questions.question: How can I evaluate if my paper fits the journal?
questions.answer: Authors should compare their manuscript objectives and methodology with the themes and examples described in the Aims & Scope page.

questions.question: Are purely theoretical papers accepted?
questions.answer: Purely theoretical papers are considered only if they demonstrate clear applied or interdisciplinary significance.

questions.question: Does SOLAV publish review articles?
questions.answer: Yes. Systematic reviews, critical reviews, and meta-analyses aligned with the journal’s scope are accepted.

questions.question: How do I submit a manuscript?
questions.answer: Manuscripts must be submitted electronically through the official submission form on the journal website.

questions.question: Do I need to create an account to submit?
questions.answer: Submission is conducted through the journal’s online form and does not require a traditional user account.

questions.question: What documents must be submitted?
questions.answer: Authors must submit the main manuscript file, author information, contact details, and supplementary materials if applicable.

questions.question: Can I submit more than one manuscript at the same time?
questions.answer: Yes. Authors may submit multiple manuscripts provided each meets ethical and originality requirements.

questions.question: Is simultaneous submission to other journals allowed?
questions.answer: No. Manuscripts must not be under consideration elsewhere during submission to SOLAV.

questions.question: Where can I find manuscript formatting rules?
questions.answer: All formatting and structural requirements are described in detail on the Author Guidelines page.

questions.question: What file format should I use?
questions.answer: Manuscripts should be submitted in editable Word (.docx) format.

questions.question: Is there a maximum word limit?
questions.answer: Recommended word limits and structure are specified in the Author Guidelines.

questions.question: How should tables and figures be prepared?
questions.answer: Figures and tables must be clearly labeled, cited in the text, and prepared according to technical specifications in the guidelines.

questions.question: What reference style does SOLAV use?
questions.answer: Authors must follow the citation and reference style specified in the Author Guidelines.

questions.question: Does SOLAV charge Article Processing Charges?
questions.answer: Yes. SOLAV applies APCs to support editorial processing, hosting, archiving, and publishing services.

questions.question: When is the APC paid?
questions.answer: APCs are paid only after the manuscript has been accepted for publication.

questions.question: Does paying APC guarantee acceptance?
questions.answer: No. Acceptance depends solely on editorial evaluation and peer review outcomes.

questions.question: Are APC waivers available?
questions.answer: Yes. SOLAV provides APC waivers and discounts for authors from low-income regions, special circumstances, and institutional agreements as described on the APC page.

questions.question: How do I apply for an APC waiver?
questions.answer: Authors should request waivers during submission or contact the editorial office with supporting information as described on the APC page.

questions.question: What criteria are used to approve waivers?
questions.answer: Waivers are evaluated based on economic conditions, institutional support, geographic factors, and editorial discretion.

questions.question: Can students receive APC waivers?
questions.answer: Students and early-career researchers may be considered for partial or full waivers subject to editorial approval.

questions.question: What type of peer review does SOLAV use?
questions.answer: SOLAV applies a rigorous double-blind peer review process in which both authors and reviewers remain anonymous to ensure impartial evaluation.

questions.question: How are reviewers selected?
questions.answer: Reviewers are selected by editors based on subject expertise, publication record, and absence of conflicts of interest.

questions.question: How long does the peer review process take?
questions.answer: Review timelines vary depending on reviewer availability and manuscript complexity. Typical review cycles are outlined on the Peer Review page.

questions.question: Can authors suggest reviewers?
questions.answer: Yes. Authors may recommend qualified reviewers, subject to editorial approval and conflict of interest screening.

questions.question: What happens if reviewers disagree?
questions.answer: When reviewer opinions diverge, editors may seek additional reviews or make an independent editorial assessment.

questions.question: Can I appeal an editorial decision?
questions.answer: Authors may submit a reasoned appeal supported by evidence. Appeals are reviewed by senior editors according to journal policy.

questions.question: What editorial decisions are possible?
questions.answer: Decisions include acceptance, minor revision, major revision, resubmission, or rejection.

questions.question: How should I respond to reviewer comments?
questions.answer: Authors must provide a detailed response letter explaining how each comment was addressed or justified.

questions.question: How much time is given for revisions?
questions.answer: Revision deadlines are specified in editorial correspondence and vary based on revision scope.

questions.question: Can I request an extension for revisions?
questions.answer: Yes. Authors may request deadline extensions by contacting the editorial office before the deadline.

questions.question: What happens if revisions are not submitted on time?
questions.answer: Failure to submit revisions within the specified timeframe may result in manuscript withdrawal.

questions.question: What ethical framework does SOLAV follow?
questions.answer: SOLAV follows international publication ethics standards aligned with COPE principles.

questions.question: What constitutes research misconduct?
questions.answer: Misconduct includes plagiarism, data fabrication, falsification, duplicate publication, and unethical experimentation.

questions.question: How are ethical complaints investigated?
questions.answer: Complaints are reviewed confidentially by editors following structured investigation procedures.

questions.question: Are human and animal studies regulated?
questions.answer: Yes. Authors must confirm compliance with ethical approval standards for human and animal research.

questions.question: What happens if misconduct is confirmed?
questions.answer: Confirmed misconduct may result in rejection, retraction, public notice, and institutional notification.

questions.question: Does SOLAV screen for plagiarism?
questions.answer: Yes. All submissions are screened using plagiarism detection tools before and during review.

questions.question: What level of similarity is acceptable?
questions.answer: Minor similarity from references and standard phrases is acceptable. Excessive similarity is not permitted.

questions.question: Is self-plagiarism allowed?
questions.answer: Duplicate publication and excessive reuse of previously published material without citation are prohibited.

questions.question: What happens if plagiarism is detected?
questions.answer: Manuscripts may be rejected or retracted and authors may face sanctions.

questions.question: Can published articles be corrected?
questions.answer: Yes. Minor errors may be corrected through formal corrigenda or errata notices.

questions.question: When is retraction necessary?
questions.answer: Retractions occur in cases of major errors, misconduct, or unreliable findings.

questions.question: Can authors withdraw a submission?
questions.answer: Authors may request withdrawal before acceptance, subject to editorial approval.

questions.question: Are retracted articles removed from the website?
questions.answer: Retracted articles remain accessible with clear retraction notices to preserve the scholarly record.

sections.section: Authorship, Contributions, and Conflicts of Interest

questions.question: Who qualifies as an author?
questions.answer: Authorship is limited to individuals who have made substantial intellectual contributions to the work.

questions.question: How are author contributions reported?
questions.answer: Authors must clearly describe individual contributions during submission.

questions.question: What is a conflict of interest?
questions.answer: A conflict exists when personal, financial, or professional relationships could influence research interpretation.

questions.question: How should conflicts be disclosed?
questions.answer: All conflicts must be declared during submission and in the manuscript if applicable.

questions.question: How are authorship disputes resolved?
questions.answer: Disputes are handled according to COPE procedures and may involve institutional mediation.

questions.question: Can AI tools be used in manuscript preparation?
questions.answer: Yes, AI tools may be used as assistive technologies under full disclosure and human supervision.

questions.question: Can AI be listed as an author?
questions.answer: No. AI systems cannot be credited as authors because they cannot take responsibility for research integrity.

questions.question: Must AI-generated images be disclosed?
questions.answer: Yes. All AI-generated visual, textual, or analytical content must be clearly declared.

questions.question: Who is responsible for AI-generated content?
questions.answer: Authors remain fully responsible for the accuracy, originality, and ethics of all AI-assisted content.

questions.question: Is automated peer review allowed?
questions.answer: No. Peer review decisions must involve qualified human reviewers.

questions.question: How are SOLAV articles indexed and discovered?
questions.answer: SOLAV provides structured metadata, open access content, and OAI-PMH harvesting services to support discovery by libraries, search engines, and indexing platforms.

questions.question: Is SOLAV listed in international databases?
questions.answer: The journal actively seeks inclusion in recognized indexing and abstracting services. Current coverage and applications are maintained by the editorial office.

questions.question: Can institutions harvest SOLAV metadata automatically?
questions.answer: Yes. Institutions may harvest metadata using the OAI-PMH interface described on the OAI-PMH page.

questions.question: How can libraries integrate SOLAV into their catalogs?
questions.answer: Libraries may use OAI-PMH harvesting, MARC conversion, and direct metadata feeds provided by SOLAV.

questions.question: Does SOLAV support Google Scholar indexing?
questions.answer: Yes. SOLAV implements citation metadata tags to support indexing by Google Scholar and similar academic search engines.

questions.question: What is the SOLAV OAI-PMH endpoint?
questions.answer: The OAI-PMH endpoint provides standardized access to article metadata for harvesting and interoperability.

questions.question: Which metadata formats are supported?
questions.answer: SOLAV supports Dublin Core and other standard metadata formats as specified on the OAI-PMH page.

questions.question: What OAI-PMH verbs are implemented?
questions.answer: SOLAV supports standard verbs including Identify, ListRecords, GetRecord, ListSets, and ListIdentifiers.

questions.question: Are resumption tokens supported?
questions.answer: Yes. Large metadata sets are delivered using resumption tokens for efficient harvesting.

questions.question: Who should be contacted for technical harvesting issues?
questions.answer: Technical support contact details are listed on the OAI-PMH and About pages.

questions.question: How should SOLAV articles be cited?
questions.answer: Each article provides citation metadata and recommended citation formats on its landing page.

questions.question: Does SOLAV provide machine-readable citation tags?
questions.answer: Yes. Article pages include meta tags such as citation_title, citation_author, and citation_pdf_url.

questions.question: Can reference managers import SOLAV records?
questions.answer: Yes. Reference managers may harvest metadata via OAI-PMH and embedded citation tags.

questions.question: Does SOLAV provide DOIs?
questions.answer: DOI assignment is managed by the journal and subject to current infrastructure and policy status.

questions.question: How are SOLAV articles preserved long-term?
questions.answer: Articles are preserved using redundant storage systems, permanent URLs, and controlled backup policies.

questions.question: What backup strategies are used?
questions.answer: SOLAV maintains multiple backups, geographically distributed storage, and routine integrity checks.

questions.question: Are archived articles protected from link rot?
questions.answer: Yes. Persistent identifiers and internal archival systems minimize the risk of broken links.

questions.question: Can archived articles be updated?
questions.answer: Only through formal correction or retraction procedures to preserve record integrity.

questions.question: May authors deposit their articles in institutional repositories?
questions.answer: Yes. Self-archiving is permitted under the terms defined in the Open Access policy.

questions.question: Which article versions may be deposited?
questions.answer: Permitted versions (preprint, accepted manuscript, published version) are specified on the Access page.

questions.question: Is embargo applied to self-archiving?
questions.answer: SOLAV generally does not impose embargo periods on permitted self-archiving.

questions.question: Must repository records link back to SOLAV?
questions.answer: Yes. Repository records should include links to the official SOLAV publication page.

questions.question: Who retains copyright of published articles?
questions.answer: Authors retain copyright while granting SOLAV publishing and distribution rights under the specified license.

questions.question: What license applies to SOLAV publications?
questions.answer: Articles are distributed under Creative Commons Attribution (CC BY 4.0) unless otherwise specified.

questions.question: Can others reuse my article commercially?
questions.answer: Yes. CC BY 4.0 permits commercial reuse with proper attribution.

questions.question: How should reused content be attributed?
questions.answer: Reusers must cite the original author(s), article title, journal name, and license.

questions.question: Can authors reuse their own work elsewhere?
questions.answer: Yes. Authors may reuse their work provided proper citation and license compliance.

questions.question: How can I check the status of my manuscript?
questions.answer: Authors may track submission status using the Track Your Paper page by providing their submission reference details.

questions.question: What do the different tracking statuses mean?
questions.answer: Statuses indicate stages such as submission received, editorial screening, peer review, revision, acceptance, and publication.

questions.question: What should I do if my status has not changed for a long time?
questions.answer: Authors may contact the editorial office via the Submit or About pages to request an update.

questions.question: Can I update my contact information after submission?
questions.answer: Yes. Updated contact information should be communicated promptly to the editorial office.

questions.question: Will I receive email notifications about my submission?
questions.answer: Yes. Authors are notified by email regarding major status changes and editorial decisions.

questions.question: Does SOLAV provide individual author profiles?
questions.answer: Yes. Author profiles display published articles and affiliation information.

questions.question: Can authors update their profile information?
questions.answer: Profile updates may be requested through the editorial office.

questions.question: What information appears on article landing pages?
questions.answer: Article pages include title, authors, affiliations, abstract, keywords, PDF links, citation metadata, and licensing information.

questions.question: Can authors request corrections to article metadata?
questions.answer: Yes. Metadata corrections may be requested through the editorial office.

questions.question: Which browsers are supported by the SOLAV website?
questions.answer: The website supports modern browsers including Chrome, Firefox, Edge, and Safari.

questions.question: Why is a page not loading correctly?
questions.answer: Display issues may result from browser cache, outdated software, or connectivity problems. Users should try refreshing or clearing cache.

questions.question: What should I do if a PDF will not open?
questions.answer: Ensure your PDF reader is updated and try downloading the file directly. If problems persist, contact support.

questions.question: How do I report broken links or errors?
questions.answer: Technical issues should be reported via the contact information on the About or Submit pages.

questions.question: Does SOLAV use cookies?
questions.answer: Cookies may be used for essential site functionality in accordance with the Privacy Policy.

sections.section: Privacy, Data Protection, and Legal Compliance

questions.question: How does SOLAV protect personal data?
questions.answer: Personal data is collected and processed in accordance with the Privacy Policy and applicable data protection regulations.

questions.question: What personal information is collected?
questions.answer: Information includes names, affiliations, email addresses, and submission-related data required for editorial processing.

questions.question: Can I request deletion of my data?
questions.answer: Data removal requests may be submitted to the editorial office subject to legal and archival requirements.

questions.question: Is SOLAV compliant with GDPR principles?
questions.answer: SOLAV applies data protection practices consistent with international privacy regulations including GDPR principles.

questions.question: Is the SOLAV website accessible to users with disabilities?
questions.answer: SOLAV strives to meet accessibility standards and provides features to improve usability for all users.

questions.question: Can alternative formats be requested?
questions.answer: Users may request alternative formats for accessibility purposes by contacting the editorial office.

questions.question: How can accessibility issues be reported?
questions.answer: Accessibility concerns should be reported using the contact information provided on the website.

questions.question: How can I submit a formal complaint?
questions.answer: Complaints should be submitted in writing to the editorial office with supporting documentation.

questions.question: How are complaints handled?
questions.answer: Complaints are reviewed confidentially and resolved according to established ethical procedures.

questions.question: What standards of conduct are expected?
questions.answer: Authors, reviewers, and editors are expected to follow principles of professionalism, respect, and academic integrity.

questions.question: Can I report unethical behavior anonymously?
questions.answer: Anonymous reports may be considered where sufficient evidence is provided.

questions.question: How can I contact the editorial office?
questions.answer: Contact details are available on the About and Submit pages.

questions.question: Who are the editors and board members?
questions.answer: Editorial board information is published on the About page.

questions.question: How are editorial policies updated?
questions.answer: Policies are periodically reviewed and updated by the editorial board.

questions.question: How can institutions collaborate with SOLAV?
questions.answer: Institutional partnerships may be discussed with the editorial office through official contact channels.
